arm_group.description: Individuals assigned to this arm are given a list of websites where they can view additional information relating to condom use.
Individuals assigned to this arm must follow an on-line one session tailored intervention.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of an online intervention in
      increasing condom use among HIV+ gay males.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Trial of an Individualized Web-Based Condom Use Intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. are HIV-seropositive,

          2. Men who are having sex with men,

          3. engaging in unprotected anal intercourse with a partner who is serostatus negative or
             unknown

          4. age 18 years and older,

          5. ability to read English

          6. have access to a computer and internet.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

intervention.description: The tailored on-line Condom-HIM intervention is composed of a single session involving activities to increase individuals self-efficacy and intention to use condoms.

clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Randomized Control Trial (RCT) of an Individualized Condom-HIM Web-based Intervention for Condom USe Among HIV+ Gay Males

other_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in participants condom use at 2-weeks post-intervention Condom Use

overall_official.affiliation: Ryerson University and Centre hospitalier de l'Universite de Montreal (CHUM)

primary_outcome.description: The Self-Efficacy for condom use measure contains a set of items to rate participant's belief that they will be able to use condoms every time they have anal sex in a variety of situations. A four-point response scale, ranging from 'strongly agree' (0) to 'strongly disagree' (4) is used. The psychometric properties of the measure have been examined and have been shown to have good internal consistency with Cronbach's alpha coefficient of 0.96.
primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in participants self-efficacy in condom use at 2-weeks post-intervention

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

secondary_outcome.description: The intention to use condoms measure asks participants their intention to consistently use condoms. The psychometric properties of the measure have been examined and have shown to have good internal consistency with Cronbach's alpha coefficient of 0.89.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in participants intention to use condoms at 2-weeks post-intervention

clinical_study.source: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
